Contractors
Our company hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety performance of the contractor is carried out. LyondellBasell Acetyls informs the contractors of known potential hazards related to contractors work and the processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release of a regulated substance occur. Contractor post evaluations are also conducted to ensure compliance with LyondellBasell Acetyls safety and health procedures.

The five-year accident history [40 CFR 68.155(d)]:
There have been no accidental releases in the past five years that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage.

The emergency response program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]:
LyondellBasell Acetyls has developed a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes emergency response activities such as providing adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas. To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced. In addition, the emergency response plan is promptly updated to reflect changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response. The La Porte Police Department is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated.

Management of Change
The Management of Change process in place at LyondellBasell Acetyls controls changes to process chemicals, equipment, technology, personnel, and procedures. Reviews are conducted prior to implementation to ensure that the change does not have adverse impact on safety, health or the environment. The Management of Change process includes notification or training of affected personnel.

Pre-Startup Safety Reviews
Pre-start up safety reviews related to new processes and to modifications in established processes are conducted as a regular practice at LyondellBasell Acetyls. These reviews are conducted to confirm that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation.

Compliance Audits
LyondellBasell Acetyls conducts compliance audits at least every three years to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented. Corrective actions required as a result of the audits are addressed in a prompt manner.

Incident Investigation
LyondellBasell Acetyls investigates incidents that have resulted in, or could have reasonably resulted in, significant release of a regulated substance. These investigations identify the immediate and underlying cause(s) as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring.

Employee Participation
Company employees and contractors are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to information created as part of the facility's implementation to the RMP rule including process safety information and process hazard analyses results. Employees participate on investigation teams, safety teams, and audit teams.

Process Hazard Analysis
LyondellBasell Acetyls conducts Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) to ensure that hazards associated with the process are identified and mitigated. The studies are undertaken by a team of personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and are revalidated at least every five years. Findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.

Operating Procedures
LyondellBasell Acetyls maintains written operating procedures for the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a turnaround. Operating procedures are regularly reviewed and are readily accessible to operators involved with the processes.

Training
LyondellBasell Acetyls has a training program in place to ensure employees that are operating processes are knowledgeable in the operating procedures associated with these processes. New employees receive basic training in process operations followed by on-the-job supervision until they are deemed competent to work independently. Refresher training is provided at least every three years or more frequently as needed.

Mechanical Integrity
LyondellBasell Acetyls carries out documented maintenance checks and inspections on process equipment to ensure its integrity. Examples of process equipment examined by these checks includes pressure vessels, storage tanks, piping systems, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, controls and pumps. This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures, and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to Title 40 Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR 68) for the LyondellBasell facility in LaPorte, Texas.

The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source [40 CFR 68.155(a)]:
LyondellBasell Acetyls is committed to employee and public safety and to protecting the environment. This commitment is inherent to our accidental release prevention program which includes conducting process hazard analysis, management of change, pre-startup safety reviews, operating procedures, mechanical integrity, and training. Safeguards are in place to prevent releases of regulated substances. If a release of a regulated substance were to occur, our trained emergency response personnel will be engaged to control and mitigate the effects of the release. LyondellBasell Acetyls also coordinates with Channel Industries Mutual Aid (CIMA) which provides additional emergency response expertise.

The stationary source and regulated substances handled [40 CFR 68.155(b)]:
LyondellBasell Acetyls' primary activities encompass Vinyl Acetate Monomer and Acetic Acid. There are three RMP-regulated substances present at LyondellBasell Acetyls in quantities greater than or equal to their threshold quantities (as listed below):
Ethylene in a flammable mixture
Propane
Vinyl Acetate Monomer
